page.title: 03How the area has changed
page.content: Truro has expanded with new housing, new shops, a shopping precinct, the cattle market has been moved out of the centre and the town always appears to have a traffic problem, and a parking problem for cars especially in Summer when the tourists visit. Some schools have got larger especially Richard Lander School, a Comprehensive set up some years ago to replace the Grammar and Secondary Modern Schools. Equipment available to pupils includes TV, overhead projectors, videos, and computers. School provides schemes of work experience just as the state has Youth Training Schemes for school leavers unable to find work. Teachers do not appear to be so strict today as in the past; and are at present involved in Industrial Action over pay and conditions. Unemployment is a problem in Truro as in Cornwall.
